item.description:

11211 142 Street
Edmonton, AB
T5M 4A1

Inside the exhibition, you will become Holmes’ eyes and ears as he tackles a baffling new case in a world steeped in innovation and experimentation. Along the way you’ll see original manuscripts, publications, period artifacts, film and television props and costumes.

Visitors will learn to use investigative tools and techniques from Holmes himself, and test yourself with exciting, interactive crime-solving opportunities.

item.title: The International Exhibition of Sherlock Holmes
item.description:
TELUS World of Science - Edmonton
11211 142 Street, Edmonton, AB
T5M 4A1
Ongoing through Monday, September 5, 2016, 6pm



More than a century ago, in 1886, a struggling young doctor named Arthur Conan Doyle wrote a story about a brilliant and enigmatic detective. The 26-year-old author would probably have been amazed to know that Sherlock Holmes would become one of the most inspiring and influential characters of all time.

The International Exhibition of Sherlock Holmes brings Sherlock Holmes to life! Step into Conan Doyle’s Victorian London and work side-by-side with his legendary detective to solve a captivating, original murder mystery in the tradition of the master detective. Become Holmes’ eyes and ears as he tackles a baffling new case in a world steeped in innovation and experimentation. Along the way you'll see a dazzling array of original manuscripts, publications, period artifacts, film and television props and costumes.

City / Town: Edmonton
Event Venue: TELUS World of Science
Short Description: The exhibition brings Sherlock Holmes to life as never before.
Event Category: Education, Exhibits, Family / Children, Major Events
Cost: $19.25 - $122.25
Where to purchase tickets: Online, in person at the Box Office or by phone.
Tickets Phone: 780-451-3344

Additional Information: The City of Edmonton Citizen Services Department operates a diverse collection of facilities, programs, and services. As part of an ongoing performance measurement and reporting system, the department will collect data each year on certain key client/customer outcomes. This data will be collected through a combination of in-house surveying and contracted surveying services provided by an independent survey company., The contracted portion of this program will consist of a combination of random telephone surveys and online surveys of Edmonton residents, who have used Citizen Services Facilities and Parks and Green Spaces, as well as registered participants of Citizen Services programs and events. These surveys will take place throughout the year.

item.description:

item.title: The Unvarnished Truth: Exploring the Material History of Painting
item.description:
ART GALLERY OF ALBERTA
2 Sir Winston Churchill Square
Edmonton AB T5J 2C1
Ongoing through Sunday, September 18, 2016, 5pm



The Unvarnished Truth: Exploring the Material History of Paintings brings together discoveries made by an international team of nearly 30 researchers―scholars of applied radiation sciences, anthropology, art history, biomedical engineering, as well as conservators, conservation scientists, forensic art historians, and curators―who worked together to examine nine historical paintings from the collections of the McMaster Museum of Art including works by Vincent Van Gogh, Alexander Rodchenko and Peter Paul Rubens’ workshop.

Related programming
Guest Lecture: The Unvarnished Truth: Exploring the Material History of Paintings, Friday, April 29, 6:30 pm, Ledcor Theatre, $10/Free AGA Members

item.title: Allora & Calzadilla: Echo to Artifact
item.description:
ART GALLERY OF ALBERTA
2 Sir Winston Churchill Square
Edmonton AB T5J 2C1
Ongoing through Sunday, August 28, 2016, 5pm

Allora & Calzadilla: Echo to Artifact is the first major exhibition in Canada of the work of internationally renowned artists Jennifer Allora and Guillermo Calzadilla. Organized by the Art Gallery of Alberta, the exhibition will feature a selection of recent work that ranges from film and sculpture to sound pieces and performances, and new work based on the artists’ research into western Canada’s prehistoric past. The works in the exhibition consider the nature of sound, music and the voice as a way to animate both natural forms and man-made artifacts - they include the remains of dinosaurs, a piece of Hadean rock and the oldest musical instrument ever discovered.

Related programming

item.title: Beauty’s Awakening: Drawings by the Pre-Raphaelites and their Contemporaries from the Lanigan Collection
item.description:
ART GALLERY OF ALBERTA
2 Sir Winston Churchill Square
Edmonton AB T5J 2C1
Ongoing through Sunday, November 13, 2016, 5pm



The young and audacious artists who called themselves the Pre-Raphaelite Brotherhood revolutionized the British art establishment of the nineteenth century with their medievalist aesthetic. John Everett Millais, William Holman Hunt, Dante Gabriel Rossetti and their fellow Pre-Raphaelites strove to uproot the teachings of the Royal Academy. At the same time Frederic Leighton, Edward Poynter and others championed them.

Featuring more than 120 drawings, Beauty’s Awakening: Drawings by the Pre-Raphaelites and Their Contemporaries from the Lanigan Collection encompasses the entire Victorian era.

Organized by the National Gallery of Canada. Presented as a part of the NGC@AGA exhibition series and with support from Simons.

Related Programming

item.title: JASON DE HAAN: Grey to Pink
item.description:
ART GALLERY OF ALBERTA
2 Sir Winston Churchill Square
Edmonton AB T5J 2C1
Ongoing through Sunday, November 13, 2016, 5pm



In this project, fossilized shells (clam, snail, brachiopod, ammonite) perch, sphinx-like, on the individual vapour spouts of a number of ultrasonic humidifiers. Many of these specimens, ranging in age from tens of thousands to hundreds of millions of years, were found in the fossil-fertile landscapes of Alberta and South Dakota.

Jason de Haan: Grey to Pink is curated by Kristy Trinier.

item.title: Touch Lab: Leave your Mark
item.description:
ART GALLERY OF ALBERTA
2 Sir Winston Churchill Square
Edmonton AB T5J 2C1
Ongoing through Sunday, July 23, 2017, 5am

Don’t touch the artwork!

How many times have you heard that at a museum or art gallery? Why is touching artwork not allowed? What other factors might affect the lifecycle of an artwork? Join us in a tactile investigation of art and art conservation to answer these questions through a series of kinesthetic explorations and activities.

Touch Lab, designed by artist and designer Anna-Karolina Szul, investigates how a variety of man-made and natural elements contribute to the wear and tear on works of art over time.

City / Town: Edmonton
Event Venue: Art Gallery of Alberta
Neighbourhood: Downtown
Short Description: BMO Children’s Gallery at the AGA.

item.title: Rusty Musicians Summer Academy
item.description:
Winspear Centre
Monday, July 25, 10am – Friday, July 29, 2016, 10pm



Hello from the Edmonton Symphony Orchestra’s Musical Creativity Team,

We are excited to be inviting you to join us for a for our first ever Rusty Musician’s Summer Academy. Offered by the Edmonton Symphony Orchestra through the Tommy Banks Institute for Musical Creativity, it’s a chance for non-professional musicians to spend five days immersed in musical performance. Taking place July 25th to 29th, participants will get expert instruction from members of the Edmonton Symphony Orchestra and other professional musicians. You will have the chance to attend classes, rehearsals and receive sectional instruction, all leading up to a performance at the Winspear Centre, conducted by ESO Music Director Bill Eddins. Opportunities for private lessons and masterclasses are also provided, as well as an optional chamber music track for even more musical opportunities.

We are encouraging all non-professional musicians, whether you continue to play weekly with your amateur orchestra, or if you used to play an instrument in a junior high band, to pull it out of the closet and get to know it again.

Please follow this link to apply through our website:
www.edmontonsymphony.com…

We hope that you will join us and pass along this invitation to the amateur musicians that you know in your community!

If a letter of support from the Edmonton Symphony would assist you in receiving funding from your school division for attending this event please let us know!

City / Town: Edmonton
Event Venue: Winspear Centre
Neighbourhood: Downtown
Short Description: Spend one amazing week in Edmonton this summer, immersing yourself in orchestral music - alsongside teaching artists from the ESO
Event Category: Concerts / Performances, Education, Museums / Attractions, Networking, Performing Arts / Culture, Seniors, Other

item.title: China Through the Lens of John Thomson (1868 – 1872)
item.description:
University of Alberta Museums Galleries at Enterprise Square (10230 Jasper Ave)
Friday, July 29, 2016



This is the first exhibition devoted to the images of China taken by the Scottish photographer John Thomson (1837 – 1921). Thomson was a pioneer in photojournalism and one of the most influential photographers of his generation.

He captured monuments and unfamiliar landscapes in his photographs, and was interested in the customs, occupation and appearance of the Chinese people – both rich and poor. All images in the exhibition are from The Wellcome Library Collection (London, England).

City / Town: Edmonton
Event Venue: Other
Neighbourhood: Downtown
Short Description: This is the first exhibition devoted to the images of China taken by the Scottish photographer John Thomson (1837 – 1921).

item.title: The Mactaggart Art Collection: Beyond the Lens
item.description:
University of Alberta Museums Galleries at Enterprise Square (10230 Jasper Ave)
Friday, July 29, 2016



A companion exhibition of selections from the renowned Mactaggart Art Collection at the University of Alberta Museums which brings to life what John Thomson saw as he travelled through China, but also what he did not see.

Guest curated by John. E. Vollmer, New York City.

The Mactaggart Art Collection is composed of more than 1,000 rare works of art, including textiles, costumes, paintings, handscrolls, albums, engravings, and other artifacts from ancient and modern East Asia.

City / Town: Edmonton

item.title: China Through the Lens of John Thomson (1868 – 1872)
item.description:
University of Alberta Museums Galleries at Enterprise Square (10230 Jasper Ave)
Saturday, July 30, 2016



This is the first exhibition devoted to the images of China taken by the Scottish photographer John Thomson (1837 – 1921). Thomson was a pioneer in photojournalism and one of the most influential photographers of his generation.

He captured monuments and unfamiliar landscapes in his photographs, and was interested in the customs, occupation and appearance of the Chinese people – both rich and poor. All images in the exhibition are from The Wellcome Library Collection (London, England).

City / Town: Edmonton
Event Venue: Other
Neighbourhood: Downtown
Short Description: This is the first exhibition devoted to the images of China taken by the Scottish photographer John Thomson (1837 – 1921).
Event Category: Exhibits, Museums / Attractions
Cost: Admission by donation
Additional Information: Gallery Hours: Thursday / Friday: 12:00 p.m. – 6:00 p.m., Saturday: 12:00 p.m. – 4:00 p.m.
More info: www.museums.ualberta.ca…

item.title: The Mactaggart Art Collection: Beyond the Lens
item.description:
University of Alberta Museums Galleries at Enterprise Square (10230 Jasper Ave)
Saturday, July 30, 2016



A companion exhibition of selections from the renowned Mactaggart Art Collection at the University of Alberta Museums which brings to life what John Thomson saw as he travelled through China, but also what he did not see.

Guest curated by John. E. Vollmer, New York City.

The Mactaggart Art Collection is composed of more than 1,000 rare works of art, including textiles, costumes, paintings, handscrolls, albums, engravings, and other artifacts from ancient and modern East Asia.

City / Town: Edmonton
Event Venue: Other
Neighbourhood: Downtown
Short Description: A companion exhibition to China Through the Lens of John Thomson (1868 – 1872) with selections from the renowned Mactaggart Art Collection
Event Category: Exhibits, Museums / Attractions
Cost: Admission by donation
Additional Information: Gallery Hours: Thursday / Friday: 12:00 p.m. – 6:00 p.m., Saturday: 12:00 p.m. – 4:00 p.m.
More info: www.museums.ualberta.ca…

item.title: Sing, Sign, Laugh and Learn
item.description:
Saturday, July 30, 2016, 2pm

Join us for singing, rhyming and signing. This is an inclusive program for children from birth to age three accompanied by a grown-up. Siblings are welcome. Parents will learn strategies to engage their child and enhance their child's communication and development through repetition, visuals and movement. Offered in collaboration with the Edmonton Early Intervention Program. Note this is not a signing course.

Cost: Free
More info: edmontonpl.evanced.info…

item.description:

Saturday, July 30, 2016, 2pm

item.title: Century Park Farmers Market
item.description:
2423 - 111th Avenue
Sunday, July 31, 2016, 10am – 3pm

Celebrating our Fourth Year!
Open Every Sunday in 2016
June 5 to Sept. 25
10:00am to 3:00pm

Vendors from all over Central Alberta, the Okanagan Valley and local artisans provide such goods as fresh fruits and vegetables, assorted farm fresh meats, honey, health products, jewelry, children’s clothing, and delicious hot foods.

Century Park Market is located at 2423 111 Street (2397 111 St), Edmonton, Alberta.

The market is accessible by car, bike, foot, or Bus/LRT. If you have any questions on our location, or how to get there, feel free to use the map to the left.
Come down and join us each Sunday

See you at the Market.

City / Town: Edmonton
Event Venue: Other
Neighbourhood: Ermineskin
Short Description: Sunday Farmers Market in South Edmonton
Event Category: Craft Show / Farmers Market
Contact Name: Patrick Moffat
Contact Phone: 780-913-2586
Contact Email: centuryparkmarket@gmail.com
More info: www.centuryparkmarket.com

item.title: Yard Gallery: a garage sale for art.
item.description:
10986 -128 street
Sunday, July 31, 2016, 10am – 5pm

item.title: Day Camps: Little House in the River Valley (Ages 8-12)
item.description:
John Walter Museum
Tuesday, August 2, 9am – Friday, August 5, 2016, 4pm



City / Town: Edmonton
Event Venue: John Walter Museum
Short Description: Experience life as an early Edmontonian!
Event Category: Education, Family / Children, Museums / Attractions
Cost: $160.00/ camper
Where to purchase tickets: ereg.edmonton.ca…
Tickets Phone: 311
Additional Information: Experience life as an early Edmontonian! Together, we'll discover the benefits of living near a river, but also the challenges that John Walter and his family faced. Campers will learn basic woodworking techniques, build their own working wooden paddle boats, and bake delicious treats in our wood burning stoves. With the river valley as our playground, we'll build forts, search for native plants and learn some orienteering skills to help us navigate around Walterdale Park. At the end of the week, we'll cool off with some homemade ice cream and a trip to Queen Elizabeth Pool., 9 AM to 4 PM daily, Course Code: 561225

Your Rights as a Tenant - July 19; Aug 9 & 30; Sept 20

Your Rights at Work - July 5 & 26; Aug 16; Sept 6 & 27

Wills and Estates - July 12; Aug 2 & 23; Sept 13
